headline: Week’s Best: Big Jump in Schwab Referral Minimums
summary: Charles Schwab  is increasing the minimum investible-asset levels for clients to participate in the Schwab Advisor Network, or SAN.  Investors once again find themselves in the midst of a Federal Reserve rate-lowering cycle.  On Sept. 17, the Fed lowered the federal-funds rate by a quarter point and signaled that two more cuts are likely by year end.

headline: Schwab’s New Assets Rise 48% on Retail Investor Demand
summary: Daily average trades grew 30% to 7.42 million, topping the 7.25 million expected by analysts.  “Strengthening organic growth trends, increasing adoption of wealth solutions and favorable macroeconomic tailwinds powered another quarter of record revenue and earnings per share,” Chief Executive Officer Rick Wurster said in a statement Thursday.  Schwab has consistently benefited from an increased interest from retail customers in investing.

Schwab has consistently benefited from an increased interest from retail customers in investing.

headline: Schwab (SCHW) Margin Surge Reinforces Bullish Narratives Despite Industry-Lagging Growth Forecasts
summary: Charles Schwab (SCHW) posted current net profit margins of 31.4%, up from 23.7% the previous year, reflecting a clear improvement in profitability. Earnings for the past year surged by 54.1%, well above the company’s five-year average growth rate of 8.2%. Investors are likely to focus on the recent acceleration in earnings growth and margin expansion as key positives in this latest release. See our full analysis for Charles Schwab. Now it’s time to see how these results stack up against the...
